How safe do you feel as a homosexual in your area? On a scale of one to ten, where one would be the safest, and ten is you expect to be dragged off of your computer at any minute by angry drunken rednecks misquoting bible passages, where would you be?
 
 To start off, I'd say that I'm a five or six, sadly. Maybe I'm being paranoid here, but in a very religious small town, one has to watch one's back.

post_info.post_title: As a homosexual, do you feel safe?

How safe do you feel as a homosexual in your area? On a scale of one to ten, where one would be the safest, and ten is you expect to be dragged off of your computer at any minute by angry drunken rednecks misquoting bible passages, where would you be?
 
 To start off, I'd say that I'm a five or six, sadly. Maybe I'm being paranoid here, but in a very religious small town, one has to watch one's back.
 Here in Mexico where I now live, I would say 3. In the USA, with the religious fanatics running loose, I would say 7.

I'd say a 2 or 3 for me. Well, few people know I'm bisexual, but I don't think I've ever met someone who would resort to violence against me if they knew. I did recieve some harsh words when I was campaigning against the amendment to ban gay marriage, but I don't think any of them would get violent.
From my perspective, everyone should be a 1. Sadly, even us heterosexual rarely feel that safe these days. But it is not based on our sexuality.

New England (at least my state) is a pretty friendly area. I would give it a 4. Even though I have been bashed here and so have others that I know. I still think on the overall, it is safer here than lots of other places I could be.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  As a homosexual, do you feel safe?
